English: Europe must be modernised, made more entrepreneurial in spirit and adapted in such a way that it becomes a more competitive environment for consumers and companies.
Danish: Europa skal moderniseres og tilpasse sig foretagsomhed og et mere konkurrencedygtigt miljø for forbrugere og virksomheder.

English: Effective competition pushes prices down and raises standards of living.
Danish: En effektiv konkurrence presser priserne og højner levestandarden.

English: It is precisely upon price levels that consumer policy has failed to focus sufficiently.
Danish: Forbrugerpolitikken har i alt for lille udstrækning været indrettet på prisniveauet.

English: In fact, competition policy and consumer policy belong together.
Danish: Konkurrencepolitik og forbrugerpolitik hører sammen.

English: The internal market is the basis for our work.
Danish: Det indre marked er grundlaget for vores arbejde.

English: Its legislation is to apply equally to all, to large and small countries alike.
Danish: Lovgivningen på det indre marked skal gælde alle - både store og små lande.

English: A systematic survey of the various national regulations is needed if barriers to competition are to be dismantled.
Danish: Det er nødvendigt med en systematisk gennemgang af de nationale regelsæt for at fjerne konkurrenceforhindringer.

English: The EU' s own regulations too may therefore need to be analysed.
Danish: Selv EU's eget regelsæt kan have brug for en gennemgang.

English: The new model now being tested by the Commission ought not to lead to a process of nationalisation pure and simple which would undermine the established competition policy.
Danish: Den nye model, som nu bliver afprøvet af Kommissionen, må ikke føre til en renationaliseringsproces, som udhuler den opnåede konkurrencepolitik.

English: In order to be effective, it must be well anchored in the Member States' national authorities.
Danish: Den skal være fast forankret i medlemsstaternes nationale myndigheder for at have nogen effekt.

English: In six months' time, it may be appropriate to carry out an analysis of the outcome and also to look more closely at the new situation' s effects upon the Commission' s role.
Danish: Om et halvt år er det måske passende at lave en analyse af resultatet, men også at se nærmere på virkningen af den nye situation på Kommissionens rolle.

English: The question of how best to make further progress has so far been solved through the idea of holding an inter-institutional congress which will open up an unbiased debate adopting a broad perspective and involving representatives of different interests.
Danish: Tanken om at afholde en kongres for alle institutionerne, der åbner for en forudsætningsløs debat ud fra et bredt perspektiv med repræsentanter fra forskellige intressenter, har indtil nu besvaret spørgsmålet om, hvordan man skal komme videre.

English: This will provide the opportunity to establish new principles or to return to the more radical changes which have been discussed.
Danish: Det giver anledning til at fastsætte nye principper eller vende tilbage til de mere gennemgribende forandringer, som er blevet diskuteret.

English: There will also be the opportunity to find new common solutions and to analyse amendments from the committee debate.
Danish: Det giver også anledning til at finde nye fælles løsninger og analysere ændringsforslagene fra udvalgsdebatten.

English: The law must be correctly applied in matters of competition.
Danish: Retspraksis i konkurrencespørgsmål skal være korrekt.

English: Wrongly applied competition policy may cause losses in the legal sphere and interfere with the right of ownership, which is an important and basic principle we should stand up for.
Danish: Forkert anvendt konkurrencepolitik kan forårsage retstab og gøre indgreb i ejendomsretten, som er et vigtigt, grundlæggende princip, vi skal værne om.

English: We have a quite exciting debate in front of us.
Danish: Vi har en meget spændende debat foran os.

English: A conference where the issues are properly debated will make it possible to straighten out misunderstandings, at the same time as perhaps improving upon certain points.
Danish: En konference, hvor spørgsmålene bliver drøftet, giver mulighed for at afklare uoverensstemmelser og samtidig måske forbedre visse punkter.

English: Parliament and the Commission can together increase their efforts to achieve an effective competition policy and so create new opportunities and new resources for our citizens.
Danish: Parlamentet og Kommissionen kan sammen styrke indsatsen for en effektiv konkurrencepolitik og dermed skabe nye muligheder og nye ressourcer for borgerne.

English: In fact, in my own constituency of Stockholm, we have many good local examples of increased supply and improved quality which have arisen precisely because of exposure to competition in areas which were previously total monopolies.
Danish: Netop i min valgkreds, Stockholm, er der mange gode lokale eksempler på øget udbud og forbedret kvalitet, der er opstået netop på grund af konkurrencebestemmelser på tidligere helt monopoliserede områder.

English: We would encourage a continuation of the open debate which has been strengthened in the course of consideration of the reports by Mr von Wogau and Mr Rapkay.
Danish: Vi opfordrer til at fortsætte den åbne debat, som er blevet øget i forbindelse med behandlingen af von Wogau- og Rapkay-betænkningerne.

English: We hope that the legal points of view will also be accorded the importance which is only reasonable in a state based on the rule of law.
Danish: Vi håber, at de retlige synspunkter også vil blive tillagt den vægt, som er rimelig i en retsstat.

English: Mr President, as a new Member I am pleased to be able to make my maiden speech here today, even though there has been a delay.
Danish: Hr. formand, kære kolleger, det glæder mig, at jeg som nyt parlamentsmedlem kan holde min første tale her i dag, selvom vi er forsinkede.

English: I would like to begin by thanking the rapporteurs Mr von Wogau, Mr Langen, Mr Rapkay and Mr Jonckheer, as well as the Commission, for their excellent cooperation.
Danish: Jeg vil gerne på forhånd takke ordførerne von Wogau, Langen, Rapkay og Jonckheer samt Kommissionen for det virkelig gode samarbejde.

English: Competition is certainly fundamental to the social market economy and European competition policy is a success story; take the energy and telecommunications sectors, where there has been a demonstrable lowering of prices and improvement in quality of service.
Danish: Konkurrence er helt sikkert grundlaget for den sociale markedsøkonomi, og den europæiske konkurrencepolitik er en succeshistorie, hvilket vi senest har oplevet inden for energi og telekommunikation, der har ført til mærkbart lavere priser, til bedre service.

English: All this is to the good of the consumer.
Danish: Alt sammen til gavn for forbrugerne.

English: But we have now arrived at a point where we need to develop competition policy further.
Danish: Nu er vi imidlertid kommet til et punkt, hvor vi skal videreudvikle konkurrencepolitikken.

English: The Commission has put forward a new White Paper on this containing two key points: dropping the obligation to notify and retrodisplacement of law enforcement.
Danish: Her har Kommissionen fremlagt en ny hvidbog med to centrale punkter: væk fra indberetningspligten, tilbageførelse af lovens gennemførelse.

English: Dropping the obligation to notify will mean less red tape and administration costs, at any rate.
Danish: Forkastelsen af indberetningspligten betyder under ingen omstændigheder mindre bureaukrati og færre udgifter.

English: At the same time, this change of system will also lead to more onus being placed on the individual in the business world, of course.
Danish: Dette systemskifte medfører selvfølgelig samtidig øget ansvar for den enkelte i erhvervslivet.

English: It will no longer simply be a case of submitting papers and having them approved; for one thing, each person will have to take responsibility themselves, and that is probably why there is unease about this in other quarters.
Danish: Det er ikke længere så enkelt, at man bare kan fremlægge og godkende tingene, nu bærer hver enkelt selv ansvaret, og det er måske også grunden til, at nogle udenfor føler ubehag derved.

English: However I believe that we should use this opportunity for Europe to set down a marker for less red tape.
Danish: Jeg mener dog, at vi bør udnytte chancen, så Europa også kan vise vejen hen imod mindre bureaukrati.

English: The second point relates to the retrodisplacement of law enforcement.
Danish: Det andet punkt er tilbageførelsen af lovens gennemførelse.

English: If we are to create a culture of law in Europe, then there is no doubt that the law must be applied not only by the Commission, by central bodies, but also by national authorities, by national courts.
Danish: For at få en retskultur i Europa skal retten helt sikkert ikke kun anvendes af Kommissionen, af centrale organer, men også af nationale myndigheder, af nationale domstole.

English: We are not discussing the fact that although every EU law is only ever decided on centrally, it is precisely the adaptation phase where we will experience a lack of legal certainty.
Danish: Vores diskussion handler jo heller ikke om, at hver enkelt EU-lovgivning altid kun skal besluttes centralt, men netop i tilpasningsfasen vil vi opleve retsusikkerhed.

English: It will certainly be necessary to develop an instrument for this in the anticipated legislative procedure that will enable enterprises to enjoy legal certainty and to have recourse to the Commission in this matter.
Danish: Her i den lovgivningsprocedure, som vi kan forvente, er det helt sikkert nødvendigt at udvikle et instrument, så virksomhederne får retssikkerhed, og de her får mulighed for at henvende sig til Kommissionen.

English: The way to a European monopolies commission must be kept clear, something that will certainly form a subject for future discussion.
Danish: Vejen til en europæisk kartelinstans bør holdes åben, og den vej vil helt sikkert blive diskuteret fremover.

English: But we need there to be more transparency in the competition policy.
Danish: Men vi har brug for øget gennemskuelighed i konkurrencepolitikken.

English: Parliament must have more involvement and I also believe that if we were to introduce a register in which we could ascertain what state aid is being granted, then this would encourage the Member States to be more disciplined.
Danish: Parlamentet skal inddrages i større omfang, og jeg mener også, at det, når vi indfører et register, hvor vi kan følge med i, hvilken statsstøtte der ydes, vil medføre disciplin i medlemslandene.

English: However, when it comes to what the future holds for competition, there are two issues dear to my heart.
Danish: Der er dog to punkter, der ligger mig meget på hjerte i forbindelse med konkurrencens fremtid.

English: One is subsidiarity.
Danish: Det ene er subsidiariteten.

English: We all hold the view that competition is vital to the economy and requires there to be efficiency, and I believe we should also permit competition in the regions.
Danish: Vi mener alle, at konkurrence er nødvendig for erhvervslivet og fremmer konkurrencedygtigheden dér, og jeg mener, at vi også bør tillade konkurrence i regionerne.

English: Competition between the regions will certainly strengthen rather than weaken the European Union.
Danish: Konkurrencen mellem regionerne vil helt sikkert styrke og ikke svække Den Europæiske Union.

English: I would cite, by way of example, the issue of job creation schemes, savings banks and regional banks, and Gütesiegel.
Danish: Her kan jeg f.eks. nævne den tyske støtte til forbedring af de regionale erhvervsstrukturer (GA-støtte), sparekasser og delstatsbanker, kvalitetsmærker.

English: Here, a region has, by its own efforts, created a means of marketing its own products.
Danish: Her har en region af egen kraft skabt noget for at markedsføre egne produkter.

English: This own initiative must not be destroyed by European intervention.
Danish: Dette initiativ må ikke ødelægges fra europæisk side.

English: I believe there is also a need to raise the de minimis regulation.
Danish: Jeg mener også, det er nødvendigt at starte deminimusordningen.

English: We should do everything within our power to force the regions into a situation where they have to compete with each other.
Danish: Vi bør sætte alt ind på at forcere konkurrencen mellem regionerne.

English: My second point relates to discussion about competition and the social market economy, although I am not going to talk about market failure just now.
Danish: Det andet er en diskussion om konkurrence og social markedsøkonomi, hvor jeg ikke står og taler om markedsforstyrrelser.

English: I have already referred to the regional and savings bank sector, but I would just like to focus on a matter one hears again and again in certain quarters.
Danish: Jeg har jo allerede været inde på delstatsbankerne og sparekasserne, men jeg vil gerne fremhæve, hvad man gentagne gange hører fra den ene eller den anden side.

English: These days, someone who lives in an old people' s home is accommodated within the social field.
Danish: En boboer på et plejehjem hører i dag ind under det sociale område.

English: However, I could also regard them as a customer, and I believe we should enter into rather clear and timely discussion on the ways in which the social field, that is evolved structures, stifle competition.
Danish: Jeg kan imidlertid også betragte ham som en kunde, og jeg mener, at vi bør diskutere ret indgående og i god tid, hvor det sociale område, hvor strukturerne betyder et stop for konkurrencen.

English: Apart from that, I could refer to any customers, any sector, as customers, and thereby have a highly destructive effect on social fields.
Danish: Ellers kan jeg her kalde enhver kunde, ethvert område kunde og derved ødelægge meget stærkt sociale områder.

English: To conclude, I would just like to say something on the principle of subsidiarity. I believe it to be of vital importance that where Member States allow regions and local authorities to raise taxes, they should continue to be able to do so and not be subject to across- the-board regulation by Europe.
Danish: Afslutningsvis vil jeg gerne sige følgende i forbindelse med nærhedsprincippet: Det er efter min mening tvingende nødvendigt, at vi dér, hvor medlemslandene gør det muligt for regionerne og kommunerne at opkræve skatter, bevarer dette og ikke regulerer i europæisk regi.

English: Thank you very much, Mr Radwan.
Danish: Mange tak, hr.

English: I would like to congratulate you on what is referred to in German parliamentary-speak, inappropriately in your case, as a maiden speech.
Danish: Radwan, jeg vil gerne lykønske Dem med det, man inden for tysk parlamentarisme i Deres tilfælde urimeligvis kalder en jomfrutale.

English: Mr President, Commissioner, I am speaking on behalf of my fellow Member, Robert Goebbels, who is unable to attend due to a political commitment.
Danish: Hr. formand, hr. kommissær, kære kolleger, jeg tager ordet på vegne af min kollega, Robert Goebbels, som er fraværende på grund af en politisk forpligtelse.

English: Within the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs, the Jonckheer report has given rise to bitter controversy on the subject of the operation of the market.
Danish: I Udvalget om Økonomi og Valutaspørgsmål opstod der på grund af Jonckheer-betænkningen uoverensstemmelser om, hvordan markedet fungerer.

English: A slim right-wing majority succeeded in removing any reference to market failures.
Danish: Det lykkedes et snævert højreorienteret flertal at fjerne enhver henvisning til markedets svagheder.

English: Even if the majority in this House were to adhere to this ultraliberal idea of a supposedly perfect market, it would not make any difference to the real world.
Danish: Selvom Parlamentet i hovedtræk skulle følge denne ultraliberale opfattelse af et såkaldt perfekt marked, vil verden for så vidt ikke ændre sig.

English: Economic relationships in the real world adequately demonstrate that eliminating all public intervention in the market does not in any way bring about perfect competition and the optimum distribution of resources.
Danish: De økonomiske forhold i virkelighedens verden viser med tilstrækkelig tydelighed, at fjernelsen af ethvert offentligt tilskud til markedet ikke på nogen måde skaber hverken en perfekt konkurrence eller en optimal fordeling af ressourcerne.
